title_sort: hannah whitman heyde to walt whitman, 17 august [1873]
title: Hannah Whitman Heyde to Walt Whitman, 17 August [1873]
text: Sunday Afternoon Aug 17Dearest Brother,I am so much afraid you have been worried about meI hope notâ€”for I care as much about your health as my ownYour letter did me good. dear Brother you are so kind to speak of coming to see me. I am down stairs, am feeling much better, more so than at any time I have had such good care. Charlie has been so kind. dear dear brothe[brother] thanks for all your letters take good care of yourself that will do me more good than you thinkI am sorry about your lameness. I think about you always.I shall get well as ever I think in time. HWH is Eoloy I send ever & ever so much love to you my dear brother and to allHan Hannah Whitman Heyde to Walt Whitman, 17 August [1873]
